column5: Excellent Fish and great report...keep them coming
Nice fish! I agree with Rizzo, they do look like Peacock Bass!

I read on a couple of other sites that Harry's in Keswick is selling minnows @$5 a scoop and Casey's in Port Bolster also has minnows...  Our friend Peter of Ice Cabins has his Bait Shack just off shore at Gilford as does Terry Goy...   BTW...congrats again Joey...you rock girl !!!  There may be a method to Paul's madness in not buying her a floater suit...if she keeps outfishing him...he may stuff her down a hole...

I went to Harry's in keswick one morning lately and he was closed, so I would trust him for anything anymore nothing like expecting to pick up supplies while helping the local businesses and the sucker is closed..nope no more money from me

We headed out in the fog this morning, with the WeatherChannel threatening rain (Wrong again, what a surprise).  We were to meet Terry at 8 a.m. at the launch.  As we turned from Ravenshoe Rd. onto 48 the truck in front of us turned out to be Terry.  Good timing or what.  We all pulled into the bait shop on 48, Captain Morbid's.  What an experience that was.  This place, from the outside, looks like a biker shop.  Inside was Mr. Morbid   , a long haired biker wannabe/you mean its not the 60's hippie.  He talked up quite a storm, in the meantime charging us $12 per scoop of minnows.  For sale in the store he had biker clothes, heavy metal shirts, drug paraphenalia, jewellery, incense, food, knick knacks you'd find in your grandmother's house, expensive shoes and designer clothes.  The tank top I fancied, he informed me, was $79     I just wondered the rest of the day who, that would pay the kind of money he wanted for designer clothes, would actually be enticed into the store in the first place.  Yes, I'll have Chanel handbag and a bag of minnows please, with air  Anyhow, on to the fishing.  It was pretty much a slush pile that turned into bigger puddles as the day went by, but there was at least 12 inches of ice and people driving cars, vans and trucks out all day long.  Terry getting ready for the bite.    Paul actually caught a fish this time, on Simcoe.  It was a day for the record books    We caught a few dinks and I lost a big one at the hole, then Terry reeled in this monster.  It was about 14 inches.      Then I finally got a big one too, came in just over 14 inches and my PB Perch, (sorry Terry)    Didn't really keep count of how many fish we caught, but we kept the two monsters and 3 medium to small ones.  Good for a nice snack.  Thanks again for your company Terry, I had a really good time.  Can't wait for laker and whitie ice  Joey
congrats on the pb and sounds like quite the shop,lol.
Great report Joey! Thanks for posting. I was worried sick. You couldn't pick up a phone?  Really nice perch there.

yeah it was great to be out fishing again with you and Paul that's quite the pace you have set, a new personal best each time out this year..... sure was a lot of water on the ice by the time we were coming in oh and yes I did se Paul catch a bunch of fish ice fishing on simcoe..whoda thounk it

Great day of fishing joey !!!.  .congrats on that big PB,monster perch !!!!    you guys will have a very nice feed of that tasty simcoe perch....nice pics of everyone too,heck even terry caught some fat perch too,way to go terry !!!...well hopefully dan,and myself will see you guys real soon on the ice i think we are going to hit virginia beach next weekend if the ice stays in decent shape after all this january thaw ?????   well we dont think that cooks bay ice will go,it should fair ok....thanks for the report joey,including the ice report as well.....cheers
Great job Terry. Looks like you all had a perfect day.
Congrats on your pb joey good to see that your out fishing the boys  rob
nice fish! Terry that spoon is killer on perch, definatly always on one of my rods.
holy smokes guys, those are peacock bass, not perch! (except Paul's...definitely a perch)
WTG......there's been some nice ones coming out of VB this year. Congrats on the PB!!   Sinker
Niiiiiiiiice perch Joey!  Congrats.
great fish & thanks for letting us know to avoid the Morbid nightmare..
Great report and pics Joey!!!  and congrats on the new PB!!!  At $12 a scoop, those musta been designer minnows too.

WOW!! Monster carp . . . .    monster perch . . . .    w'at's next . . . . .    a 10 pound whitie or a 25 pound laker? I don't believe the price this guy's chargin' for minnows . . . .    is he the ONLY place up there? How about Harry's in Keswick on the way up? He ALWAYS gives a GOOD scoop, was $3.50 last year? Or anybody down in Scarberia . . . .    LUCKY'S . . . .   (Midland & Sheppard) $3.00 will getcha a WEEK'S supply of emeralds, and he has all the basic gear you need, pretty reasonably priced. But . . . .    I JUST GOTTA get a shot at some of those MONSTER fish . . . .    w'at the secret Joey? How do ya do it?
Atta girl!
Well done Jo, Paul and Terry! What is Paul doing wearing that funny suit? -Brian
It sure beats wearing a red blanket, Brian. Callander Bay will never be the same.
And the PB's continue, eh Joey !!
Glad ya all had a good time, WTG...

Wow!  Another PB!!  Great report Joey...and Terry, that's a great photo edit job.....looks amazing!  I'll have to send you a pic or two....LOL.  Thanks for the report Joey....I can see you're gearing up to win the Tyler even this year!!
congrats Joey, thanks for sharing your day  John
Not sure if I want to fish near you!  congrats!
Prince charming. Im not.  That suit is a xl and still to tight in the shoulders.  BIG CHIEF!!
Hey Joey,whens that guy going to buy you a floater suit?? got any b'days coming or anniversary?
